The primary responsibilities of the Chief Justice of the Michigan Supreme Court are to serve as the head of the court's criminal division and to supervise all other justices on the court. He or she is responsible for assigning cases to the justices, determining the outcome of cases, and overseeing the work of the court. The Chief Justice also serves as the court's chief advisor on constitutional law, legal ethics, and policy.

### “Natural selection is the process by which individuals with desirable traits tend to survive and reproduce more successfully than others.”
